messageBody:
I am using the built in eclipse test runner.
The settings in Windows->Preferences->Java->JUnit only show me some
packages and classes, I think they are of JUnit3, such as:
JUnit.framework.TestCase.
I can't see 'Enable Assertion for JUnit... ' anywhere.

Ofer

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Kuropkat <robert@...> wrote:
>
> *This message was transferred with a trial version of CommuniGate
(tm) Pro*
>
> Are you just using the built in eclipse test runner or ant? As I
> recall, just adding the junit v4 jar made it work in eclipse. You
might
> ckeck Windows->Preferences->Java->JUnit settings and make sure
> everything is fine. You should see listings for JUnit 3 AND JUnit
4.
> Make sure you check 'Enable Assertions for JUnit ..."
>
> My problem was in running JUnit v4 from Ant. To do this, I had to
> install Ant 1.7.x and update the ANT_HOME within Eclipse since it
comes
> with a built in Ant 1.6.x installation.
>
> Robert Kuropkat
>
> P.S. You may need to make sure you have all the latest Eclipse
updates...
>
>
